definition: to do/to make/to produce/to write/to compose/to act as/to engage in/to hold (a party)/to be/to become/to function (in some capacity)/to serve as/to be used for/to form (a bond or relationship)/to pretend/to feign/to act a part/to put on appearance

sentences.english: As often as I praised him for his hard work, he kept silent.
sentences.chinese: 每當我表揚他工作勤奮時，他總是默不做聲。
而現在，他們悶不做聲了。

sentences.english: He was silent, lowering his head.
sentences.chinese: 他這才低下頭不做聲了。

sentences.english: As I lay on the floor, I realized everyone was silent.
sentences.chinese: 當我躺在地板上時，我意識到大家都不做聲了。

sentences.english: His silence (signified) that he was unaware of what had happened.
sentences.chinese: 他的默不做聲就表明他沒有意識到發生了什麼。
他們大笑了一陣，接着突然不做聲了。

sentences.english: Elizabeth said no more -- but her mind could not acquiesce.
sentences.chinese: 伊麗莎白不做聲了，可是她心裏依舊不敢贊同。

sentences.english: He looked at me in silent wonder.
sentences.chinese: 他驚訝地默不做聲地看着我。
副總統坐在椅上，默不做聲。

sentences.english: 34But they kept quiet because on the way they had argued about who was the greatest.
sentences.chinese: 門徒不做聲，因爲他們在路上彼此爭論誰爲大。

sentences.english: Messenger quietly silent, the answer is correct.
sentences.chinese: 使者默不做聲，答案是正確的。

sentences.english: Michael hears them and immediately becomes silent.
sentences.chinese: Michael聽到了他們的聲音馬上不做聲了。

sentences.english: Elizabeth said no more -- but her mind could not  acquiesce.
sentences.chinese: 伊麗莎白不做聲了，可是她心裏依舊不敢贊同。

sentences.english: The mother is still not say a word, but more rocking sound of textile machines.
sentences.chinese: 這位老母仍不做聲，只不過紡織機搖得更響。

sentences.english: As she was putting on her earrings, though, I looked down and stopped short.
sentences.chinese: 妻子戴耳墜時，我有意向下看，不做聲。

sentences.english: They set up camp without saying much, picketed the horses in the meadow.
sentences.chinese: 他們默不做聲地安營紮寨，然後把馬牽到坡上去喫草。
